TopicTitle: recentering a ship in the VAB

Articles.Content:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/127743-Recentering-a-craft-in-the-SPH-%28and-maybe-the-VAB

I'm changing this section:


PART
{
	part = probeStackLarge_4294743608
	partName = Part
	pos = -1.208919,46.29612,-4.368912
	attPos = 0,0,0
	attPos0 = -1.208919,46.29612,-4.368912
	rot = 0,0,0,1
	attRot = 0,0,0,1
	attRot0 = 0,0,0,1
	mir = 1,1,1
	symMethod = Radial
	istg = 0
	dstg = 0

	link = asasmodule1-2_4294596024
	link = decoupler1-2_4294660614
	attN = bottom,decoupler1-2_4294660614
	attN = top,asasmodule1-2_4294596024

of the craft file. which, if I'm reading it right is the root part.

specifically I'm changing pos and attPos0 to 0,46.29612,0. when I try, it just moves the probe core and nothing else. any suggestions?

I have tried dragging the craft to center it but I always seem to push the thing halfway out the door.

after a second look before posting it looks like the position is preserved through all the parts.

for example:

	part = decoupler1-2_4294660614
	partName = Part
	pos = -1.208919,45.65526,-4.368912

and

	part = asasmodule1-2_4294596024
	partName = Part
	pos = -1.208919,46.73612,-4.368912

now, I can run it through excel (openoffice calc, lotus, visicalc, etc.) and have it spit out new numbers for all the parts. but the rots will give me a bit of trouble... looks like they are precalcualted sines of the angles for rot. can anybody confirm?

I like the idea of editing the .craft file, and I do it from time to time. But in this case, it's probably better to drag. Since you had trouble dragging it before, this mod might help:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/131821-Modding-Monday-WasdEditorCamera

From a different angle, you might have better luck moving the thing back into place.

If you decide to edit anyway, I think your plan should work. The positions should all change by the same amount in the same direction, while the rots shouldn't need to change at all.
Using the offset gizmo on the root part will let you reposition the whole craft, far easier than trying to drag it.

should is the word...

it is when i see stuff like this in there that i worry.

i can tell that some of that is floating point drift, the .49999-> and the E-08 parts.

"Why should I do it easier and safer when I can make it hard and break everything?"

Rhompaia is right. Use the offset tool on the root part and stop messing with the save file to do something that is much more reliably done from within the game UI.
+1 to using the offset tool. That's what it's there for. The combination of its snap-to-grid feature with the big white circle painted on the VAB floor makes centering quick and easy.

Start a new craft; choose a cubic octagonal strut as the root (and only) part; merge in your existing craft and attach it to the cubic strut; use the re-root tool to make a part on your craft the root; delete the cubic strut.
